track_strategy: Adjust braking points to account for lower peak grip; maximize minimum apex speed through high-load corners by reducing lateral scrub. A +10°C track temperature delta requires managing surface temperatures via reduced slip angles, while a -10°C delta necessitates aggressive inputs to maintain core temperature. In the event of accelerated degradation, initiate tire-saving protocols including short-shifting and prepare for a revised pit window. Any precipitation requires an immediate pit stop for the appropriate wet compound and a rearward brake balance migration.
